worse.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: GRAMMAR: Comparatives
worse.translation[0].note_box[1].items[0: The comparative form of bad is worse
The problem is getting more worse
worse.translation[0].note_box[2].section: worse
more unpleasant, bad, severe etc, or of a lower standard or quality
Recent reports indicate that the situation is getting worse.
Your French is even worse than mine!
inferior
of a lower standard or quality than something else, or less good than someone else
Their wines are of inferior quality.
an inferior product
Trying to do things on the cheap only results in an inferior service.
not compare with something
used to emphasize that someone or something is not nearly as good, big, or nice as someone or something else
This recording just doesn’t compare with his early recordings.
Our sales this year do not compare with last year’s outstanding results.
not be in the same league
used to emphasize that the standard of someone or something is not nearly as good as someone or something else
He’s pretty good, but he’s not in the same league as his brother.
not be a patch on something/somebody
use this to emphasize that something is not nearly as good as something else, especially something that came before it
The film wasn’t a patch on the book.
He’s not a patch on Tarantino as a director.
worse.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: in a more severe or serious way than before
worse.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: By lunch time it was raining worse than ever.
worse.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: We thought the situation was bad, but worse was to follow.
